sentences.sContent: The men who work on the oil rigs are a tough bunch.
sentences.sCn: 在石油钻塔上工作的都是吃苦耐劳的人。

sentences.sContent: ...deciding what to do upon graduation can be a tough decision to say the least...
...Times are so tough that even bosses are taking pay cuts...
...which are schools that better serve our children and our nation by encouraging students to tackle tough subjects under the guidance of gifted teachers...
...high-quality sustainable materials can still be tough to fine...
...He is bit of a tough character and she is rather selfish...

synos.tran: 艰苦的，困难的；坚强的，不屈不挠的；坚韧的，牢固的；强壮的，结实的

phrases.pCn: [美国口语]勇敢地承受；坚持到底
非常坚强的人；不易动感情的人；自信者
大胆果断的人；暴躁的人
严厉的爱（指为起到帮助作用而严厉地对待有问题的人）

trans.tranOther: strong enough to deal successfully with difficult conditions or situations
